    "When a proton with a magnetic moment is placed in a strong external magnetic field, its behavior becomes quantized.",

    "the nuclear magnetic quantum number, m I, which for a proton can be plus one-half or minus one-half.",
    "we focus on the longitudinal component of the magnetic moment",
    "gamma times Planck’s constant divided by four pi",
    "the fundamental energy levels we use in MRI"
  ]

evidence: When a proton with a magnetic moment is placed in a strong external magnetic field, its behavior becomes quantized.
quantum mechanics tells us that only certain orientations are allowed.
the nuclear magnetic quantum number, m I, which for a proton can be plus one-half or minus one-half.
we focus on the longitudinal component of the magnetic moment
gamma times Planck’s constant divided by four pi
the fundamental energy levels we use in MRI
